name: Abkhaz
citation: Chirikba, V. A. Abkhaz. München: LINCOM, 2003.
recommend: It's a tiny grammar, so it's very concise (almost too concise and dense, if you ask me) so if the student has a linguistics background then it should be fine

name: Aguaruna
citation: A Grammar of Aguaruna (Iiniá Chicham), Simon E Overall, De Gruyter Mouton, 2015.
recommend: Yes, my grammar was fine to work with (even if not perfect)

name: Apurinã
citation: (The Language Of The Apurinã People of Brazil, Sidney Da Silva Facundes, SUNY Buffalo, 2000)
recommend: Yes, my grammar was fine to work with (even if not perfect)

name: Arapaho
citation: Cowell, A., & Moss Sr, A. (2008). The Arapaho Language. University Press of Colorado.
recommend: Maybe (e.g., perhaps only for a student with a linguistics background)

name: Berbice Dutch Creole
citation: Kouwenberg, Silva. (1994). A grammar of Berbice Dutch Creole. Berlin: Mouton de Gruyter.
recommend: Yes, my grammar was great to work with

name: Chalcatongo Mixtec

recommend: Yes, my grammar was great to work with
